snippet: Aware that he will never replace the current mayor in the hearts of the financial elite, Bill de Blasio is engaged in a delicate courtship with New York City’s plutocrat class.
abstract: New York City mayoral candidate Bill de Blasio, aware that he will never replace Mayor Michael R Bloomberg in the hearts of the financial elite, is engaged in a delicate courtship with New York's plutocratic class; in private meetings with moguls and financiers, who are rattled by his anti-corporate rhetoric, de Blasio, left-leaning Democrat, tries to reassure them he is not plotting to go to war with them.

byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and SUSANNE CRAIG

lead_paragraph: Aware that he will never replace the current mayor in the hearts of the financial elite, Bill de Blasio is engaged in a delicate courtship with New York City’s plutocrat class.

headline.main: Wooing ‘Hometown Industry,’ de Blasio Meets Wary Wall St.
headline.print_headline: Wooing ‘Hometown Industry,’ De Blasio Meets Wary Wall St.
